qas.question: What are two examples of glam metal bands?
What two genres cut into hard rock's popularity at the end of the 1980s and early 1990s?
What were some hard rock bands of the 1970s?

answers.text: Led Zeppelin, The Who, Deep Purple, Aerosmith, AC/DC and Van Halen

qas.question: What style did some hard rock bands embrace in the 1980s?
When did soft rock become a major form of popular music?
Which band became popular in the 1960s?
When did some bands move from pop rock to hard rock?
What band made a come back in the mid-1990s?
When did hard rock replace grunge and Britpop?

context: Hard rock developed into a major form of popular music in the <b4_0><b5_0>1970s<b5_0/><b4_0/>, with bands such as <a2_0>Led Zeppelin, The Who, Deep Purple, Aerosmith, AC/DC and Van Halen<a2_0/>. <b6_0>During the 1980s<b6_0/>, some hard rock bands moved away from their hard rock roots and more towards <a3_0>pop rock<a3_0/>, while others began to return to a hard rock sound. Established bands made a comeback in the mid-1980s and it reached a commercial peak in the 1980s, with glam metal bands like <a0_0>Bon Jovi and Def Leppard<a0_0/> and the rawer sounds of <b7_0>Guns N' Roses<b7_0/>, which followed up with great success in the later part of that decade. Hard rock began losing popularity with the commercial success of <a1_0>grunge and later Britpop<a1_0/> <b8_0>in the 1990s<b8_0/>.
